intro: Physaria kingii subsp. bernardina, commonly known as the Bernard's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders, a characteristic feature of the Physaria genus. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
